The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that what was going on with them is solely related to an unseen and ancient race: The half-African/Berber people living near to death city of lost sphinxes (exactly like Cairo originated from Alexandria, Knossos once originated from Crete). Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes that pulls you back and reminds me of your childhood and some incredible work by its writers, technicians and directors.
The story starts with an opening scene monologue whose translator “Yōsuke Matsuzaki” made a very good job on (the original japanese version’s being severely repetitive).

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have long since left Planet Earth, for adventures in the countless empires that make up the Galaxy beyond. Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an attempt to catch the wave of martial arts popularity ; It borrows many characteristics and themes from Asian and American cinema alike, while substituting thick Italian-American accents for Japanese Kathoey or Chinese speech motifs.
